A battery pack is designed to operate at 25 C using natural convection for cooling. It will now be deployed in a desert environment with ambient temperatures reaching 55 C. List the assumptions in the original design that may no longer hold.
A satellite radiator panel is modeled assuming steady-state thermal conditions. What assumptions are being made, and which are most likely to break in orbit?
A pressure vessel is designed using room-temperature material properties. Identify assumptions that become invalid at cryogenic temperatures.
A structural component is analyzed assuming linear elastic behavior. Under extreme vibration and thermal cycling, what assumptions may fail?
An avionics enclosure relies on forced-air cooling inside a sealed compartment. It will be exposed to high-altitude low-pressure conditions. What assumptions in the thermal design may no longer hold?
A composite panel is qualified based on short-duration thermal exposure tests. It will now operate continuously near its maximum rated temperature. Identify assumptions that may break.
A chemical sensor is calibrated at standard atmospheric pressure and humidity. It will be deployed in a high-humidity, low-pressure environment. What assumptions in measurement accuracy may fail?
A rotating mechanical assembly was analyzed assuming constant lubrication viscosity. It will operate in sub-zero temperatures. Identify assumptions that become invalid.

A high-voltage power supply is designed assuming clean sinusoidal input power. It will be deployed in an environment with frequent voltage spikes and harmonic distortion. What assumptions may no longer hold?
A heat exchanger is sized assuming constant coolant flow rate. It will operate in a system where pump performance degrades over time. What assumptions may fail?
A control algorithm is tuned assuming low sensor latency and minimal noise. It will now operate with delayed and noisy measurements. What assumptions may break?
An optical system is qualified assuming clean vacuum conditions. It will operate in a dusty, radiation-exposed environment. What assumptions may fail?
A structural adhesive is qualified using short-term shear tests at room temperature. It will be exposed to long-term cyclic loading and humidity. What assumptions may break?
A fluid pipeline is designed assuming incompressible flow and steady operating pressure. It will experience rapid pressure transients and temperature swings. What assumptions may no longer hold?

A radiation shielding analysis assumes uniform material density and isotropic radiation exposure. The system will operate near a localized radiation source with directional flux. What assumptions may fail?
